intro: Geniostoma micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Geniostoma micranthum is adapted to Mediterranean climates with wet winters and dry summers.
